intro: Pachystela subverticillata, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. Its leaves are leathery and arranged in whorls, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats.
